newsitem.title: INDIA: India cotton mixed, dealers seek Gujarat varieties.
newsitem.headline: India cotton mixed, dealers seek Gujarat varieties.

text.p: Punjab varieties remained steady at the improved level but Gujarat cotton climbed up on the local market, dealers said on Wednesday.
Punjab cotton was quiet in limited activity as sluggish mill demand matched dwindling supplies. Daily arrivals of cotton in the Punjab region dropped to 1,000/1,200 bales (170 kg each).
"Millers have switched their attention from Punjab cotton to Gujarat varieties as availability of good quality cotton was higher in Gujarat region compared to Punjab," one broker said.
Fresh mill buying in Gujarat cotton lifted prices of Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) in spot deals by 100 rupees at 14,000/14,500 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
Gujarat wagad also moved up by 50 rupees at 12,850 rupees per candy and Gujarat Kala-ginned rose by 100 rupees at 12,300/12,500 rupees per candy.
Punjab saw-ginned was quoted at the previous level of 1,650/1,680 rupees per maund (37.32 kg), as was Bengal-deshi at 925/965 rupees per maund.
The Bombay cotton market will be closed on Thursday for a Buddhist festival, and will reopen for trading on Friday.
